Avril Haines is exceptionally well-qualified to be the next Director of National Intelligence based on her performance as Deputy Director of the CIA and as Deputy National Security Advisor.  Avril’s experience intellect values and work ethic will make her an exceptional DNI.

Secretary @JohnKerry has been an internationally recognized outspoken advocate for uniting the world to fight climate change since long before he served as Secretary of State.   The U.S. must again claim the mantle of leading the fight against a truly global existential threat.

Alejandro Mayorkas is a smart and natural pick to lead the Department of Homeland Security.  There is much work to be done in restoring the reputation and credibility of DHS after the Trump Admin's disastrous and inhumane immigration policies and he is the right man for the job.

Jake Sullivan is a respected American foreign policy strategist who has served this nation with distinction.  Most importantly Mr. Sullivan has been a leading proponent of utilizing America's founding democratic values as a core component of our national security.

Linda Thomas-Greenfield represents the best of Foreign Service professionals who dedicate their lives to serving Americans & strengthening the institutions they lead.   @LindaT_G will bring extraordinary experience to her new role & will be an excellent representative to the UN.

Tony Blinken arrives well-versed in the intricacies & importance of the State Dept.  As former SFRC Staff Director & national security team member for the Obama-Biden Admin @ABlinken has earned his reputation as hard-working studious and as a leading thinker on foreign policy.

These 10 people have been unjustly detained for too long. Amid #COVID19 releasing them is an even more urgent issue. That’s why I along with 11 of my Senate colleagues sent letters to the Central Asian presidents urging them to release those detained for peaceful activism NOW.

Akrom Malikov a researcher at a university in Uzbekistan was detained on extremism charges for allegedly writing articles for the opposition People’s Movement. He was convicted of plotting to overthrow the government. @HRW describes the charges as “politically-motivated.” https://t.co/nfG3E3i8qR

Iskandar Khudaiberganov has been serving a life sentence since 2002 for “terrorism” “murder” & “attempting to overthrow the constitutional order.” @HRW says his conviction was based on confessions obtained under torture and witness statements later retracted in court. https://t.co/dk6UqFnUat

Omruzak Omarkulyev was arrested after creating an informal Turkmenistan students’ club while studying abroad in Turkey. He’s reportedly been sentenced to 20 yrs in prison on unknown charges. @freedomnoworg criticized the “lack of transparency & political motivation” in his case. https://t.co/naVORiqTgn

Mansur Mingelov was arrested after documenting cases of torture & ill-treatment of the Baloch community in Turkmenistan. @amnesty wrote he was sentenced “in an unfair trial in retaliation for complaints about torture in police detention.” He is at high-risk for #COVID19. https://t.co/qcqOHp2rB6

Gulgeldy Annaniyazov has been detained in Turkmenistan since 2008 when he returned after living in Norway as a political refugee. He served 11 years for illegal entry into the country & faces 5 more. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention says his detention “is arbitrary.” https://t.co/frpSfmWQFX

Buzurgmehr Yorov was sentenced by a Tajikistan court to 10+ years in prison for defending a client who claimed he was being tortured & framed. @amnesty wrote that the charges are “likely to be politically motivated.” He is at high #COVID19 risk due to prison conditions. https://t.co/AaLlQX81Cl

Journalist Daler Sharipov was detained in Tajikistan for “inciting religious discord” for his work publishing articles on human rights and religious freedom. @HRW calls the charges “fabricated” and “baseless.” He is at high #COVID19 risk due to prison conditions in Tajikistan. https://t.co/NexgRV8YEw

Azimjon Askarov is serving a life sentence in Kyrgyzstan on trumped up charges. @UNHumanRights found he had been “arbitrarily detained…tortured & mistreated & prevented from adequately preparing his trial defence.” His health is deteriorating & he is at high #COVID19 risk. https://t.co/kRFxjHxG0d

Maks Bokayev was arrested in Kazakhstan for his work fighting for the environment expression & against torture. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention said his detention was based on his exercise of “freedom of expression & freedom of assembly.” He’s at high #COVID19 risk. https://t.co/tqmrErkaT1

Aset Abishev was arrested in Kazakhstan for posts in support of Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan movement. @freedomhouse cited his case as an example of Kazakhstan persecuting opposition parties. He has been punished for expressing concerns about prison conditions & #COVID19. https://t.co/JevRXYd3FY

Individuals should never be imprisoned for peaceful activism. I urge Central Asian leaders to release prisoners held for these legitimate acts including cases across #Kazakhstan #Kyrgyzstan #Tajikistan #Turkmenistan & #Uzbekistan. The #COVID19 prison risk raises the stakes.

So many communities are seeing the dire public health & economic effects of #COVID19.  It's not a blue state or red state issue—it's an American issue.  Our bipartisan SMART Fund is a reasonable sensible approach to get states cities & towns the help they deserve.

We also need funds for states cities and towns that have been hit hard by #COVID19.  I’m happy to partner with @SenBillCassidy in the Senate and @RepSherrill in the House to fight for our $500 billion SMART Fund that would give our communities the help they need.

There is much more work to do to ensure the safety and economic wellbeing of our residents and communities.  I stand ready to fight for New Jersey’s priorities in Washington.

5️⃣ We also won an unprecedented $377 billion pool of economic aid for America’s small businesses.  These low-cost and forgivable loans will help New Jersey’s restaurants retailers and other local businesses make payroll pay rent protect jobs & ultimately drive our recovery.

4️⃣ We also secured major improvements to unemployment benefits.  For the first time ever employers will be able to furlough workers instead of lay them off enabling them to keep their health benefits while receiving an additional four months of enhanced unemployment benefits.

3️⃣ It comes to the aid of small businesses and workers suffering as a result of the drastic but vital social distancing measures we must take to prevent the spread of the coronavirus and ultimately save lives.  This includes direct payments to American families.

2️⃣ It responds to the urgent needs of states like NJ which has already spent billions battling the nation’s 2nd-highest number of COVID-19 cases.  The state stabilization funds I fought for will ensure NJ’s state and local governments are not bankrupted by the #COVID19 battle.

1️⃣ This package will deliver billions of dollars of aid and loans to hospitals so that our doctors nurses and frontline health care workers have the resources they need to conduct testing treat the sick and ultimately save lives.
But we fought back we stood our ground and today we have a bipartisan deal that gives New Jersey and the nation a fighting chance at defeating #COVID19 and restoring the promise of our economy.

The solutions are right in front of us.  As I said following the Senate #ImpeachmentTrial I love this nation too much to stand by and let our great Republic be trampled on again. #FPOversight  My full remarks at @BrookingsInst @BrookingsFP: https://t.co/BoyXdKRdig

Oversight in foreign policy is more critical in the face of President Trump.  This President has demonstrated that unless required he will not comply.  We need to protect against current AND future abuses of power that threaten our constitutional order. #FPOversight
8️⃣ STRENGTHENING COMMITMENT TO UKRAINE:   We need to repair our relationship with Ukraine and protect it from being used as a political football.
7️⃣ PROTECTING PUBLIC SERVANTS:   We must call out the corrosive rhetoric used to disparage non-partisan public servants. They serve our country and our Constitution not just any one president.
6️⃣ WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTIONS:   We need to strengthen protections and make whistleblower protection training mandatory for all State Department employees.

5️⃣ INCREASING PROTECTIONS FOR DIPLOMATS & PUBLIC SERVANTS:   Congress must pass a Marie Yovanovitch Act to better protect diplomats and career public servants in the face of an administration that fails to and openly attacks them.
4️⃣ REDUCE POTENTIAL FOR CONFLICTS BY PRIVATE ACTORS:   We need new guardrails to ensure that U.S. foreign policy occurs via official channels NOT private ones.

3️⃣ STRENGTHENING CONGRESS’ HAND:   We must impose penalties for the executive branch failing to comply with congressional requests and expedite judicial review for resolving congressional-executive disputes.

2️⃣ BETTER TRANSPARENCY:  We need to require agencies to tell Congress if foreign assistance is not spent as directed by Congress within clear timeframes and with clear consequences for failing to do so.

1️⃣ BAN FOREIGN SOLICITATION:  We must make it against the law for any U.S. govt official to solicit foreign action for personal or political benefit and require anyone aware of such an attempt to report it to Congress.

Let’s not forget: the President has already made clear he is willing to seek foreign interference in elections.  That’s why I’m calling for a package of new reforms to guard our Republic against future abuses of power. #FPOversight
